intro: Mabea surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam mabea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds. Mabea surinamensis is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
